Messy evening commute ahead, then a warm-up

Snow could make highways slippery during rush hour and a winter weather advisory is in effect for all of southern New England this afternoon and evening. (Boston.com, 12:30 p.m.)

Senate special election set for June 25

A primary will be held on April 30 in the race to fill John F. Kerry's Senate seat, Secretary of State William F. Galvin said today. (Globe, 12:18 p.m.)

Arrests made in fatal Brazil nightclub fire

Brazilian police said they have made three arrests and are seeking a fourth person in connection with a fire that killed more than 230 people. (AP, 9:31 a.m.)
  • Pictures Scenes from the tragic Brazil club fire

Gisele Bunchden sends love to victims of Brazil club fire

Lynn bank building evacuated after fire

The fire generated black, heavy smoke inside the building that serves as the regional headquarters for Eastern Bank, officials said. (Boston Globe, 11:20 a.m.)
